RT @ASP . @SenTedCruz (R-TX) discusses the economic crisis and his approach to #covid19relief with the Recovery Act, a proposal to reduce taxes and regulations for Americans and businesses. Learn more about the #covid19response on ASP.

We are going to tax Jeff Bezos, Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, and the other billionaires' outrageous pandemic wealth accumulation so we can provide health care to all our people. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee0oXolX0AAg8Ob.jpg

Very true. https://twitter.com/benshapiro/status/1291751265710428160 QT @benshapiro The difference in media treatment between Trump's innocuous "Thigh-land" gaffe and Biden's utterly non-innocuous "black people all think the same" gaffe is incredible.

Trillions are being used to ensure there’s a floor for the stock market during our public health and economic crises from the #TrumpVirus.

Trillions are needed to ensure there is a not only a floor for America’s working families but a roof overhead for the children, as well.

RT @TeamPelosi Whether schools get the resources they need cannot depend on a system of reward and punishment that is based on their willingness to put children at risk of the #coronavirus. 

We have to do *our* homework if we want children back in class – safely.

RT @TeamPelosi Our death toll of more than 160,000 souls tells us that the #coronavirus never took a pause. The academic year isn’t taking a pause, either.

For the children, we will keep working to find common ground to overcome this historic challenge. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1291901189207072768/pu/img/5oH44Enk5BOJBz2k.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1291901189207072768/pu/vid/480x270/3oj9gFLwYS7KLAm3.mp4?tag=10

Today I’m endorsing my colleague @IlhanMN in her re-election campaign. From tackling the climate crisis to putting power in the hands of the people, Ilhan is a partner in the fight for big structural change. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee59X3cXsAASzSY.jpg
Reminder: Trump is actively trying to overturn Obamacare during a global pandemic. His executive order is meaningless.

O LORD, I have heard your renown,and am in awe, O LORD, of your work. In the course of years revive it,in the course of years make yourself known;in your wrath remember compassion!

Habakkuk 3:2

Sen. Rubio and @RepLeeZeldin led a group of legislators in urging the @TheJusticeDept to require Qatari-owned media company Al Jazeera to register as a foreign agent.

How many ways can the new Postmaster General sabotage the @USPS? The @OIGUSPS should also investigate why Louis DeJoy is removing top officials who run day-to-day operations. It's his job to get the mail delivered on time, not play partisan games. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/08/07/postal-service-investigation-dejoy/

Another reason we need real economic support for families (extended UI, stimulus checks, payment relief, etc) is to make school reopening plans w/ the purpose of maximizing public health, rather than sacrifice peoples’ lives to fuel an economy that doesn’t even value theirs.

If it’s not safe enough for indoor dining, what makes it safe enough for indoor schooling?

(...and restaurants actually have soap in the bathrooms)

40 million Americans – mostly Black & Latinx – could be evicted this year. That’s like the entire population of CA losing their homes. We must pass my bill to extend & expand the eviction moratorium & @SenSherrodBrown's bill for rental assistance right now https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/07/economy/eviction-stimulus/index.html

This is the clearest example yet of Trump and his puppet Postmaster General's attempts to sabotage the USPS before November's election.

This kind of behavior is why we're demanding an investigation into Trump’s USPS—the Inspector General should add this to their list. https://twitter.com/TheProspect/status/1291917044351479809 QT @TheProspect The Postal Service has informed states that they’ll need to pay first-class 55-cent postage to mail ballots to voters, rather than the normal 20-cent bulk rate. That nearly triples the per-ballot cost.

https://prospect.org/coronavirus/unsanitized-federal-benefit-extension-anger-unemployment-evictions/
@ratemyskyperoom @mattklapper What a re-leaf!

RT @JoeBiden John Lewis will be remembered as a moral giant who dedicated his life to creating a more just, equal, and moral America.

Donald Trump will not. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee2sL31XoAA9l1t.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1291874027951316992/vid/320x320/_dy3peypX_PmiA8i.mp4?tag=13

It could not be more clear they are trying to take down the United States Postal Service from the inside—at a time when we need it the most.

Congress must immediately step up to save the Postal Service and safeguard our elections. There’s no time to waste. https://twitter.com/marceelias/status/1291879818141798406 QT @marceelias 🚨🚨🚨Postmaster General Louis DeJoy unveiled a sweeping overhaul of the nation’s mail service, displacing the two top executives overseeing day-to-day operations, according to a reorganization memo released Friday. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/08/07/postal-service-investigation-dejoy/?hpid=hp_hp-more-top-stories_postal-155pm%3Ahomepage%2Fstory-ans&tidr=a_breakingnews

People in jail are disproportionately contracting & dying of #COVID19 due to the inability to social distance & higher rates of underlying health issues. To track & stop the spread of this virus & save lives, we need data that reflects the reality of the crisis we are facing. https://twitter.com/ABCWorldNews/status/1291480124156792832 QT @ABCWorldNews Citing the growing toll from a hidden side of the coronavirus pandemic, top Democratic lawmakers are looking to require state and federal prisons to open their books on the number of cases behind bars. https://trib.al/gwADHFK

Billionaires need the working class. 

The working class does not need billionaires.

It's happening again. Russia is trying to interfere in our election.

We can't stand by silently as one of our top foreign adversaries attempts to undermine our democracy and help re-elect Donald Trump. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee6kyKsXkAEZvFd.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1292150975432712193/vid/486x270/sD312nYdKh5_zPui.mp4?tag=13

America will be judged harshly for this administration’s neglect of the wellbeing of immigrant children. It’s up to Congress to step in and fight for their health and safety. @SenJackyRosen and I are leading our colleagues in a push to do just that.

Trump may not know it while playing golf with his billionaire friends, but millions of unemployed Americans are now going hungry and facing evictions. If the GOP can provide $1 trillion in tax breaks for the rich, they can support a $600 supplement for unemployment insurance.

For those who live in the #305 please consider going to vote early for @SteveBovo for Mayor of #Miami Dade County.

http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1290249567150256129/pu/img/XCzFHUwPWS0MNjOp.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1290249567150256129/pu/vid/476x270/qsWwdS3O6hwI6hw7.mp4?tag=10

RT @DeAngelisCorey Rand Paul: "My bill will take all that federal money under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act and give that money directly back to the children"

That would fund students instead of systems. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1291906550139965440/pu/img/HlQsDsPLcgClkNGz.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1291906550139965440/pu/vid/430x270/cunQM2_WRyA32Cbt.mp4?tag=10

Donald Trump and Republicans are afraid of young people making their voices heard. 

And they should be—it means they’re going to lose. https://twitter.com/AMarch4OurLives/status/1291343261542490113 QT @AMarch4OurLives This morning we ran our first TV ad on Fox & Friends and Morning Joe. We’re telling those in the halls of the White House and Congress, the NRA’s boardroom, and the penthouses of 5th Avenue: young people will determine the nation's future. #OurPower http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EesqzcrWAAACFNk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1291167211416158208/vid/480x270/ucJOcXHgBq5ZN_Oa.mp4?tag=13

RT @RepChuyGarcia This op-ed by @SenWarren and @carroll_fife is a stark reminder that if Congress doesn’t act now to protect tenants and homeowners, our country will face an avalanche of evictions and further corporate consolidation. https://twitter.com/senwarren/status/1291519768462266369 QT @SenWarren After the 2008 crash, corporations grabbed up homes & became the worst kind of slumlords. We can’t let history repeat itself with a private equity real estate grab. Read my op-ed with @carroll_fife on what we must do to confront this looming crisis. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/08/06/nation-is-facing-housing-crisis-private-equity-firms-just-see-dollar-signs/

@nytimes⁩ gets its very wrong in questioning the capabilities & intentions of China & Iran

Iran has sophisticated capabilities

China’s are far more sophisticated than Russia’s

And neither is “supposedly” anti-Trump, they are unquestionably anti-Trump https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/08/magazine/us-russia-intelligence.html?referringSource=articleShare

This week, @RepAOC and I introduced the Climate Equity Act, legislation to ensure that we center the fight against the climate crisis around justice and equity.

Proud that we were able to propose an inclusive and comprehensive policy with input from community leaders. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1291470165067145216 QT @thehill Harris, Ocasio-Cortez push climate equity bill with Green New Deal roots https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/510920-harris-aoc-push-climate-equity-bill-with-green-new-deal-roots http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Eew5RVjWkB8Og02.png

Family run institution Rio Cristal in Miami closed for good due to #COVID-19. 

#PPP helped them survive the first wave of closure. But when the 8 weeks ran out they couldn’t hang on. 

We will see many more of these across the country without #PPPII  https://www.miamiherald.com/miami-com/restaurants/article244775442.html

Democrats put forth a comprehensive plan to respond to #COVID19 months ago—back in May. Senate Republicans wasted time, and now, as unemployment benefits expire, they want to call us obstructionists. Americans are hurting—it’s time to act boldly. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1292199587764109317/img/cAmVQAQQCpTudonD.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1292199587764109317/vid/480x270/o6iJfewhxZyARHx9.mp4?tag=13

I remember how terrified my parents were when my daddy couldn't work and we almost lost our home. That story is happening to millions of families right now.

We must extend the $600 unemployment checks to keep them from falling off the financial cliff. https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/07/loss-of-600-a-week-unemployment-boost-leaves-many-in-trouble.html

RT @Kat_Cammack I am proud to have earned the endorsement of Senator @DrRandPaul in our campaign for #FL03.

As your Congresswoman, I would be proud to stand alongside him and our President, @realDonaldTrump for conservative values and to work every day to drain the swamp. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee57ZO_WAAAT-C2.jpg

RT @LambdaLegal The inhumane conditions in prisons in this country are a toxic petri dish. There is no opportunity for social distancing. This is deadly.

Thank you for your leadership @SenWarren @RepPressley @PattyMurray @SenBooker @RepSylviaGarcia @RepYvetteClarke @RepRobinKelly. https://twitter.com/SenWarren/status/1291469797033750528 QT @SenWarren COVID-19 is out of control in prisons & jails. All 10 of the largest US clusters are correctional facilities. @RepPressley, @PattyMurray, @SenBooker, @RepSylviaGarcia, @RepYvetteClarke, @RepRobinKelly & I have a bill to find out the severity of this crisis.https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/coronavirus-spreads-nations-jails-prisons-lawmakers-demand-transparency/story?id=72213761

RT @tedlieu I’m going to keep shouting this: with conservative control of Supreme Court, WH & Senate, the House can’t stop voter suppression. That means we must prepare voters to overcome it. If you’re going to vote by mail, then vote early. If you’re voting on 11/3, then expect long lines. https://twitter.com/msnbc/status/1292075877807857664 QT @MSNBC “Something definitely changed at the post office,” President of the American Postal Workers Union Mark Diamondstein says. “A few weeks ago, the new postmaster general put in some policies that we don’t think can do anything but slow down mail.”
https://trib.al/LfLxin2

Trump just promised that if he wins reelection he'll gut Social Security and Medicare.

A vote for @JoeBiden in November means protecting and expanding these benefits—ensuring our seniors have the ability to retire with dignity.

Congratulations, @fallonfortexas! On to victory in November! https://twitter.com/PatrickSvitek/status/1292207885607460865 QT @PatrickSvitek Just in: @FallonforTexas wins #TX04 Republican nomination on first ballot, with an 82-vote majority. 

Fallon will replace John Ratcliffe on the November ballot and likely succeed him in January, given that the district is solidly red.

RT @chiproytx Did you catch my interview on the Mark Levin Show yesterday? 

Listen to why Mark said #TX21 is "one of the House races that I'm most focused on" and "your election is absolutely crucial!"

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iKMRD8tR4Vk

RT @chiproytx 87 days until Election Day! 

We’re out across #TX21 and talking with a lot of folks excited about getting out to vote to #KeepTexasRed and #StandUpForAmerica!

Join us: http://chiproy.com/engage/ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee66AfPXoAE5aBF.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee66AfNWAAUbj84.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ee66AfPWAAIMGsH.jpg

President Trump. Stop being a total fraud and support the $600 a week unemployment supplement passed by the House 2 months ago. 

How can states come up with 25% of the cost when many of them are already on the verge of bankruptcy? What a scam. https://twitter.com/npr/status/1292207703549448193 QT @NPR The previous enhanced unemployment benefits added $600 a week to standard state unemployment benefits. But Trump's executive action would cut it to $400 and require states to fund 25% of it.
 https://www.npr.org/2020/08/08/900516854/in-executive-actions-trump-extends-unemployment-benefits?utm_term=nprnews&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=npr

Private equity is gearing up to run the same playbook they ran during the 2008 financial crisis—and we all know what happened then.

The good news is that we know how to keep this from happening. Now we just have to have the courage to do it. https://twitter.com/theappeal/status/1291494508341760001 QT @theappeal Sen. Elizabeth Warren and housing activist Carroll Fife on preventing real estate speculation during in the COVID-19 housing crisis: "We cannot stand by while this history repeats itself.” https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2020/08/06/nation-is-facing-housing-crisis-private-equity-firms-just-see-dollar-signs/
RT @DiamondandSilk .@SenTedCruz and @michaeljknowles stopped by to talk to Diamond and Silk about their new podcast, VERDICT with Ted Cruz. https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1lPKqLlkAvWxb

RT @AriFleischer “American adults who follow three rules—finish high school; get a full-time job; and wait until at least age 21 to get married and have children—have a 2% chance of being poor and a 75% chance of being a middle-class wage earner.” https://www.dailysignal.com/2020/08/07/the-collapse-of-the-traditional-american-family/

The ship is sinking and Trump came with duct tape. Rather than do their jobs and help pass a comprehensive bill to help millions who are hurting, the White House and Senate Republicans are giving up and moving on.

These are totally insufficient. Congress. Must. Act. https://twitter.com/latimes/status/1292200373726228480 QT @latimes Breaking: Trump signs executive orders aimed at bypassing Congress on coronavirus relief https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2020-08-08/trump-executive-orders-bypassing-congress-coronavirus-relief

This is all a stunt—cutting unemployment benefits and threatening Social Security and Medicare only deepen the pain people are feeling.

Congress must act in a way that meets the scale of this crisis. Trump and Senate Republicans need to stop the games and come to the table now. https://twitter.com/latimes/status/1292201179917635584 QT @latimes President Trump said he would take unilateral action to provide financial relief to Americans struggling with the coronavirus crisis, but it was doubtful he had the legal authority to do so. https://www.latimes.com/politics/story/2020-08-08/trump-executive-orders-bypassing-congress-coronavirus-relief

Democrats repeat our call to Republicans to return to the table, meet us halfway and work together to deliver immediate relief to the American people.

Read my full statement with @SenSchumer: https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/8820

Today’s meager announcements show President Trump still does not comprehend the seriousness or the urgency of the health and economic crises facing working families. These policies provide little real help for families.

Today, Trump announced that if he is re-elected he will permanently defund Social Security. That may make sense to the billionaires at his country club, but it makes zero sense to me. 

No, Mr. President. We will not let you destroy Social Security. We will defeat you – badly.

And Congress should do more – a lot more – for people struggling with student loan debt. We need to #CancelStudentDebt for federal and private student loan borrowers to help boost our economy. https://www.forbes.com/sites/adamminsky/2020/07/15/over-100-civil-rights-groups-tell-congress-cancel-student-debt-in-next-stimulus-bill/#1e4ef5d81487

Renters don't need empty words about protection from eviction & rental assistance – they need guarantees. The President's Executive Order does nothing meaningful to stop the evictions that are taking place right now.

We need a universal eviction ban & rental assistance.

Cutting unemployment benefits by $200 & sticking cash-strapped states that desperately need relief with the tab will hurt families, limit our economic recovery, & cost us 1.7 million jobs. Congress must fully extend the $600 checks right now. https://www.epi.org/blog/unemployment-insurance-claims-remain-historically-high-congress-must-reinstate-the-extra-600-immediately/

I’ve led the fight in the Senate for years to protect & expand Social Security. I promise you, Mr. President: if you want to gut Social Security and break our promises to seniors, veterans, & Americans with disabilities, you’re going to lose that fight. https://www.cnn.com/2020/08/07/politics/social-security-medicare-trump-payroll-taxes/index.html

If Donald Trump cared about helping Americans, he would have demanded @SenateMajLdr McConnell start negotiating as soon as the House passed the HEROES act almost two months ago. These legally dubious actions aren’t real relief for states and families – they’re a cruel joke.

87 days left until Election Day. That’s 87 days to make a difference. 87 days to phone bank. To get people registered to vote. To donate to Democratic campaigns up and down the ballot. 

Make these 87 days count.

Advisory yesterday had nothing to do with pressure from Dems. Intel professionals announced weeks ago they would be issuing frequent public advisories on elections security.

And this incessant politicization helps advance China,Russia & Iran’s efforts.
 https://www.politico.com/news/2020/08/08/russian-interference-democrats-strategy-392582

RT @HBO “Injustice is not built to last.”  — @AOC

The new documentary, Seeing America with @mPinoe premieres tomorrow at 10 pm. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EeSGYOAUcAEhKTu.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1289302945083793408/vid/480x270/wNpJnHgnsTJK8Ld_.mp4?tag=13

America’s working families are facing more economic insecurity and we've now lost 160,000 souls as a result of this Administration’s continued failure to adopt a strategic plan to stop the #TrumpVirus.

There’s no reasonable argument for slashing the relief they need to survive.

We face an uphill battle to heal this nation, rebuild our economy, and create a government that works for all of us—not just the wealthy and well-connected.

None of this will be easy.

But you don’t get what you don’t fight for.

82% of #COVID19 deaths in #Florida were people over 65,about half of who were residents or staff of nursing & long-term care facilities.

So then why don’t we make it our singular priority to protect people over 65, especially those in nursing & longterm care facilities?
